column4: hi guys...hoping you can help, apt isn't working for me...it keeps getting stuck at "waiting for headers" no matter what I try (apt-get update was the last attempt) yet the repo in my sources.list is pinging fine
are my messages actually getting through to the channel?!
*crackle* yep
pinging from the same PC?
indeed...I'm not sure whats wrong with it
checked all your settings, network gateway, DNS, proxy? not using a web proxy at all?
aye I checked all that...its at this point that I would usually purge the program and reinstall....but its apt ><
is it physical or a VM?
physical
I'm on it now...the internet is otherwise working fine
hmm can you wireshark it from another box, or backup sources.list and try another mirror for fun?
I have a UNR netbook...does it use the same package store?
have to admit i have no idea
I shall check sources.list
same sources and it works fine under UNR...something on this laptop has gone wrong
do both resolv.conf's link to the router IP or the ISP's DNS? (or opendns/google DNS etc?)
it keeps saying something about retriving packages from unauthenticated sources......
when I do an apt-get install: WARNING: The following packages cannot be authenticated!
on the problematic one?
aye
I haven't added any repos
can you pastebin the exact error and your sources?
sure one sec
I now appear to have lost my right click and c+p functionality.........
